   20: 
   21: -module(bs_construct_no_opt_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25: 	 test1/1, test2/1, test3/1, test4/1, test5/1, testf/1,
   26: 	 not_used/1, in_guard/1,
   27: 	 mem_leak/1, coerce_to_float/1, bjorn/1, append_empty_is_same/1,
   28: 	 huge_float_field/1, system_limit/1, badarg/1,
   29: 	 copy_writable_binary/1, kostis/1, dynamic/1, bs_add/1,
   30: 	 otp_7422/1, zero_width/1, bad_append/1, bs_append_overflow/1,
   31:          bs_append_offheap/1,
   32:          reductions/1, fp16/1, zero_init/1, error_info/1, little/1,
   33:          heap_binary_unit/1,
   34:          otp_24_code_gh_8238/1
   35:         ]).
   36: 
   37: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   38: 
   39: suite() ->
   40:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   41:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   42: 
   43: all() -> 
   44:     [test1, test2, test3, test4, test5, testf, not_used,
   45:      in_guard, mem_leak, coerce_to_float, bjorn, append_empty_is_same,
   46:      huge_float_field, system_limit, badarg,
   47:      copy_writable_binary, kostis, dynamic, bs_add, otp_7422, zero_width,
   48:      bad_append, bs_append_overflow, bs_append_offheap,
   49:      reductions, fp16, zero_init,
   50:      error_info, little, heap_binary_unit,
   51:      otp_24_code_gh_8238].
   52: 
   53: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   57:     application:stop(os_mon).
   58: 
   59: -define(T(B, L), {B, ??B, L}).
   60: -define(N(B), {B, ??B, unknown}).
   61: 
   62: -define(FAIL(Expr), fail_check(catch Expr, ??Expr, [])).
   63: 
   64: -define(FAIL_VARS(Expr, Vars), fail_check(catch Expr, ??Expr, Vars)).
   65: 
   66: l(I_13, I_big1) ->
   67:     [
   68:      ?T(<<-43>>,
   69: 	[256-43]),
   70:      ?T(<<56>>,
   71: 	[56]),
   72:      ?T(<<1,2>>,
   73: 	[1, 2]),
   74:      ?T(<<4:4, 7:4>>,
   75: 	[4*16+7]),
   76:      ?T(<<777:16/big>>,
   77: 	[3, 9]),
   78:      ?T(<<777:16/little>>,
   79: 	[9, 3]),
   80:      ?T(<<0.0:32/float>>,
   81: 	[0,0,0,0]),
   82:      ?T(<<0.125:32/float>>,
   83: 	[62,0,0,0]),
   84:      ?T(<<0.125:32/little-float>>,
   85: 	[0,0,0,62]),
   86:      ?T(<<I_big1:32>>,
   87: 	[138, 99, 0, 147]),
   88:      ?T(<<57285702734876389752897684:32>>,
   89: 	[138, 99, 0, 148]),
   90:      ?T(<<I_big1:32/little>>,
   91: 	lists:reverse([138, 99, 0, 147])),
   92:      ?T(<<-1:17/unit:8>>,
   93: 	lists:duplicate(17, 255)),
   94: 
   95:      ?T(<<I_13>>,
   96: 	[13]),
   97: 
   98:      ?T(<<4:8/unit:2,5:2/unit:8>>,
   99: 	[0, 4, 0, 5]),
  100: 
  101:      ?T(<<1:1, 0:6, 1:1>>,
  102: 	[129]),
  103:      ?T(<<1:1/little, 0:6/little, 1:1/little>>,
  104: 	[129]),
  105: 
  106:      ?T(<<<<1,2>>/binary>>,
  107: 	[1, 2]),
  108:      ?T(<<<<1,2>>:1/binary>>,
  109: 	[1]),
  110:      ?T(<<4,3,<<1,2>>:1/binary>>,
  111: 	[4,3,1]),
  112: 
  113:      ?T(<< <<153,27:5>>:I_13/bits, 1:3 >>,
  114:         [153,217]),
  115: 
  116:      ?T(<<(256*45+47)>>,
  117: 	[47]),
  118: 
  119:      ?T(<<57:0>>,
  120: 	[]),
  121: 
  122:      ?T(<<"apa">>,
  123: 	"apa"),
  124: 
  125:      ?T(<<1:3,"string",9:5>>,
  126: 	[46,110,142,77,45,204,233]),
  127: 
  128:      ?T(<<>>,
  129: 	[]),
  130: 
  131:      ?T(<<37.98:64/native-float>>,
  132: 	native_3798()),
  133: 
  134:      ?T(<<32978297842987249827298387697777669766334937:128/native-integer>>,
  135: 	native_bignum()),
  136: 
  137:      ?T(<<$э/native-utf16,$т/native-utf16,$о/native-utf16," спутник"/native-utf16>>,
  138:         native_utf16()),
  139: 
  140:      ?T(<<$в/native-utf32,"ода"/native-utf32>>,
  141: 	native_utf32()),
  142: 
  143:      %% Unit tests.
  144:      ?T(<<<<5:3>>/bitstring>>, <<5:3>>),
  145:      ?T(<<42,<<7:4>>/binary-unit:4>>, <<42,7:4>>),
  146:      ?T(<<<<344:17>>/binary-unit:17>>, <<344:17>>),
  147:      ?T(<<<<42,3,7656:16>>/binary-unit:16>>, <<42,3,7656:16>>),
  148: 
  149:      %% Different sizes and types. First without types.
  150:      ?T(<<I_big1:8>>, [147]),
  151:      ?T(<<I_big1:16>>, [0, 147]),
  152:      ?T(<<I_big1:24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  153:      ?T(<<I_big1:32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  154:      ?T(<<I_big1:40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  155:      ?T(<<I_big1:48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  156:      ?T(<<I_big1:56>>, [249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  157:      ?T(<<I_big1:64>>, [42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  158: 
  159:      %% Known integer with range.
  160:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):8>>, [147]),
  161:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):16>>, [0, 147]),
  162:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  163:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  164:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  165:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  166:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):56>>, [249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  167:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 64) - 1)):64>>, [42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  168: 
  169:      %% Known integer with exact range.
  170:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl  8) - 1)):8>>, [147]),
  171:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 16) - 1)):16>>, [0, 147]),
  172:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 24) - 1)):24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  173:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 32) - 1)):32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  174:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 40) - 1)):40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  175:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 48) - 1)):48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  176: 
  177:      %% Known integer without range.
  178:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):8>>, [147]),
  179:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):16>>, [0, 147]),
  180:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  181:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  182:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  183:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  184:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):56>>, [249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  185:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):64>>, [42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  186: 
  187:      %% Known integer. Verify that the value does not bleed into the
  188:      %% previous segment.
  189:      ?T(<<1, (I_big1 + 0):8>>,  [1, 147]),
  190:      ?T(<<2, (I_big1 + 0):16>>, [2, 0, 147]),
  191:      ?T(<<3, (I_big1 + 0):24>>, [3, 99, 0, 147]),
  192:      ?T(<<4, (I_big1 + 0):32>>, [4, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  193:      ?T(<<5, (I_big1 + 0):40>>, [5, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  194:      ?T(<<6, (I_big1 + 0):48>>, [6, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  195:      ?T(<<7, (I_big1 + 0):56>>, [7, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  196:      ?T(<<8, (I_big1 + 0):64>>, [8, 42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  197: 
  198:      %% Test non-byte sizes.
  199:      ?T(<<I_big1:33>>, <<197,49,128,73,1:1>>),
  200:      ?T(<<I_big1:39>>, <<11,20,198,1,19:7>>),
  201: 
  202:      ?T(<<I_big1:57>>, <<124,242,130,197,49,128,73,1:1>>),
  203:      ?T(<<I_big1:58>>, <<190,121,65,98,152,192,36,3:2>>),
  204:      ?T(<<I_big1:59>>, <<95,60,160,177,76,96,18,3:3>>),
  205:      ?T(<<I_big1:60>>, <<175,158,80,88,166,48,9,3:4>>),
  206:      ?T(<<I_big1:61>>, <<87,207,40,44,83,24,4,19:5>>),
  207:      ?T(<<I_big1:62>>, <<171,231,148,22,41,140,2,19:6>>),
  208:      ?T(<<I_big1:63>>, <<85,243,202,11,20,198,1,19:7>>),
  209: 
  210:      %% Test non-byte sizes and also that the value does not bleed
  211:      %% into the previous segment.
  212:      ?T(<<17, I_big1:33>>, <<17, 197,49,128,73,1:1>>),
  213:      ?T(<<19, I_big1:39>>, <<19, 11,20,198,1,19:7>>)
  214:     ].
  215: 
  216: native_3798() ->
  217:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  218: 	<<0,1>> -> [64,66,253,112,163,215,10,61];
  219: 	<<1,0>> -> [61,10,215,163,112,253,66,64]
  220:     end.
  221: 
  222: native_bignum() ->
  223:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  224: 	<<0,1>> -> [129,205,18,177,1,213,170,101,39,231,109,128,176,11,73,217];
  225: 	<<1,0>> -> [217,73,11,176,128,109,231,39,101,170,213,1,177,18,205,129]
  226:     end.
  227: 
  228: native_utf16() ->
  229:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  230: 	<<0,1>> -> [4,77,4,66,4,62,0,32,4,65,4,63,4,67,4,66,4,61,4,56,4,58];
  231:         <<1,0>> -> [77,4,66,4,62,4,32,0,65,4,63,4,67,4,66,4,61,4,56,4,58,4]
  232:     end.
  233: 
  234: native_utf32() ->
  235:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  236: 	<<0,1>> -> [0,0,4,50,0,0,4,62,0,0,4,52,0,0,4,48];
  237:         <<1,0>> -> [50,4,0,0,62,4,0,0,52,4,0,0,48,4,0,0]
  238:     end.
  239: 
  240: evaluate(Str, Vars) ->
  241:     {ok,Tokens,_} =
  242: 	erl_scan:string(Str ++ " . "),
  243:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  244:     case erl_eval:expr(Expr, Vars) of
  245: 	{value, Result, _} ->
  246: 	    Result
  247:     end.
  248: 
  249: eval_list([], _Vars) ->
  250:     [];
  251: eval_list([{C_bin, Str, Bytes} | Rest], Vars) ->
  252:     case catch evaluate(Str, Vars) of
  253: 	{'EXIT', Error} ->
  254: 	    io:format("Evaluation error: ~p, ~p, ~p~n", [Str, Vars, Error]),
  255: 	    exit(Error);
  256: 	E_bin ->
  257: 	    [{C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes} | eval_list(Rest, Vars)]
  258:     end.
  259: 
  260: one_test({C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes}) when is_list(Bytes) ->
  261:     io:format("  ~ts, ~p~n", [Str, Bytes]),
  262:     Bin = list_to_binary(Bytes),
  263:     if
  264: 	C_bin == Bin ->
  265: 	    ok;
  266: 	true ->
  267: 	    io:format("ERROR: Compiled: ~p.~nExpected ~p.~nGot ~p.~n",
  268: 		      [Str, Bytes, binary_to_list(C_bin)]),
  269: 	    ct:fail(comp)
  270:     end,
  271:     if
  272: 	E_bin == Bin ->
  273: 	    ok;
  274: 	true ->
  275: 	    io:format("ERROR: Interpreted: ~p.~nExpected ~p.~nGot ~p.~n",
  276: 		      [Str, Bytes, binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  277: 	    ct:fail(comp)
  278:     end;
  279: one_test({C_bin, E_bin, Str, Result}) ->
  280:     io:format("  ~ts ~p~n", [Str, C_bin]),
  281:     if
  282: 	C_bin == E_bin ->
  283: 	    ok;
  284: 	true ->
  285: 	    Arbitrary = case Result of
  286: 			    unknown ->
  287: 				size(C_bin);
  288: 			    _ ->
  289: 				Result
  290: 			end,
  291: 	    case equal_lists(binary_to_list(C_bin),
  292: 			     binary_to_list(E_bin),
  293: 			     Arbitrary) of
  294: 		false ->
  295: 		    io:format("ERROR: Compiled not equal to interpreted:"
  296: 			      "~n ~p, ~p.~n",
  297: 			      [binary_to_list(C_bin), binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  298: 		    ct:fail(comp);
  299: 		0 ->
  300: 		    ok;
  301: 		%% For situations where the final bits may not matter, like
  302: 		%% for floats:
  303: 		N when is_integer(N) ->
  304: 		    io:format("Info: compiled and interpreted differ in the"
  305: 			      " last bytes:~n ~p, ~p.~n",
  306: 			      [binary_to_list(C_bin), binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  307: 		    ok
  308: 	    end
  309:     end.
  310: 
  311: equal_lists([], [], _) ->
  312:     0;
  313: equal_lists([], _, _) ->
  314:     false;
  315: equal_lists(_, [], _) ->
  316:     false;
  317: equal_lists([A|AR], [A|BR], R) ->
  318:     equal_lists(AR, BR, R);
  319: equal_lists(A, B, R) ->
  320:     if
  321: 	length(A) /= length(B) ->
  322: 	    false;
  323: 	length(A) =< R ->
  324: 	    R;
  325: 	true ->
  326: 	    false
  327:     end.
  328: 
  329: fail_check({'EXIT',{badarg,_}}, Str, Vars) ->
  330:     try	evaluate(Str, Vars) of
  331: 	Res ->
  332: 	    io:format("Interpreted result: ~p", [Res]),
  333: 	    ct:fail(did_not_fail_in_intepreted_code)
  334:     catch
  335: 	error:badarg ->
  336: 	    ok
  337:     end;
  338: fail_check(Res, _, _) ->
  339:     io:format("Compiled result: ~p", [Res]),
  340:     ct:fail(did_not_fail_in_compiled_code).
  341: 
  342: %%% Simple working cases
  343: test1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  344:     I_13 = id(13),
  345:     I_big1 = id(57285702734876389752897683),
  346:     Vars = [{'I_13', I_13},
  347:             {'I_big1', I_big1}],
  348:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(l(I_13, I_big1), Vars)).
  349: 
  350: %%% Misc
  351: 
  352: %%% <<A:S, A:(N-S)>>
  353: comp(N, A, S) ->
  354:     M1 = (1 bsl S) - 1,
  355:     M2 = (1 bsl (N-S)) - 1,
  356:     [((A band M1) bsl (N-S)) bor (A band M2)].
  357: 
  358: gen(N, S, A) ->
  359:     [?T(<<A:S, A:(N-S)>>, comp(N, A, S))].
  360: 
  361: gen_l(N, S, A) ->
  362:     [?T(<<A:S/little, A:(N-S)/little>>, comp(N, A, S))].
  363: 
  364: test2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  365:     test2(0, 8, 2#10101010101010101),
  366:     test2(0, 8, 2#1111111111).
  367: 
  368: test2(End, End, _) ->
  369:     ok;
  370: test2(I, End, A) ->
  371:     test2(I, A),
  372:     test2(I+1, End, A).
  373: 
  374: test2(S, A) ->
  375:     N = 8,
  376:     Vars = [{'A',A}, {'N',N}, {'S',S}],
  377:     io:format("Vars: ~p\n", [Vars]),
  378:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen(N, S, A), Vars)),
  379:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_l(N, S, A), Vars)).
  380: 
  381: %%% Tests without facit
  382: 
  383: t3() ->
  384:     [?N(<<4711:13, 9876:13, 3:6>>),
  385:      ?N(<<4.57:64/float>>),
  386:      ?N(<<4.57:32/float>>),
  387: 
  388:      ?N(<<>>)
  389:     ].
  390: 
  391: test3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  392:     Vars = [],
  393:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(t3(), Vars)).
  394: 
  395: gen_u(N, S, A) ->
  396:     [?N(<<A:S, A:(N-S)>>)].
  397: 
  398: gen_u_l(N, S, A) ->
  399:     [?N(<<A:S/little, A:(N-S)/little>>)].
  400: 
  401: test4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     test4(0, 16, 2#10101010101010101),
  403:     test4(0, 16, 2#1111111111).
  404: 
  405: test4(End, End, _) ->
  406:     ok;
  407: test4(I, End, A) ->
  408:     test4(I, A),
  409:     test4(I+1, End, A).
  410: 
  411: test4(S, A) ->
  412:     N = 16,
  413:     Vars = [{'A', A}, {'N', 16}, {'S', S}],
  414:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_u(N, S, A), Vars)),
  415:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_u_l(N, S, A), Vars)).
  416: 
  417: gen_b(N, S, A) ->
  418:     [?T(<<A:S/binary-unit:1, A:(N-S)/binary-unit:1>>,
  419: 	binary_to_list(<<A:S/binary-unit:1, A:(N-S)/binary-unit:1>>))].
  420: 
  421: %% OTP-3995
  422: test5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  423:     test5(0, 8, <<73>>),
  424:     test5(0, 8, <<68>>).
  425: 
  426: test5(End, End, _) ->
  427:     ok;
  428: test5(I, End, A) ->
  429:     test5(I, A),
  430:     test5(I+1, End, A).
  431: 
  432: test5(S, A) ->
  433:     N = 8,
  434:     Vars = [{'A', A}, {'N', 8}, {'S', S}],
  435:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_b(N, S, A), Vars)).
  436: 
  437: %%% Failure cases
  438: testf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     ?FAIL(<<3.14>>),
  440:     ?FAIL(<<<<1,2>>>>),
  441: 
  442:     ?FAIL(<<2.71/binary>>),
  443:     ?FAIL(<<24334/binary>>),
  444:     ?FAIL(<<24334344294788947129487129487219847/binary>>),
  445:     BigInt = id(24334344294788947129487129487219847),
  446:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<BigInt/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  447:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<42,BigInt/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  448:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<BigInt:2/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  449: 
  450:     %% One negative field size, but the sum of field sizes will be 1 byte.
  451:     %% Make sure that we reject that properly.
  452:     I_minus_777 = id(-777),
  453:     I_minus_2047 = id(-2047),
  454:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<I_minus_777:2048/unit:8,57:I_minus_2047/unit:8>>,
  455: 		     ordsets:from_list([{'I_minus_777',I_minus_777},
  456: 					{'I_minus_2047',I_minus_2047}])),
  457:     ?FAIL(<<<<1,2,3>>/float>>),
  458: 
  459:     %% Negative field widths.
  460:     testf_1(-8, <<1,2,3,4,5>>),
  461:     ?FAIL(<<0:(-(1 bsl 100))>>),
  462: 
  463:     ?FAIL(<<42:(-16)>>),
  464:     ?FAIL(<<3.14:(-8)/float>>),
  465:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(-16)/binary>>),
  466:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(2.5)/binary>>),
  467:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(anka)>>),
  468:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(anka)>>),
  469: 
  470:     %% Unit failures.
  471:     ?FAIL(<<<<1:1>>/binary>>),
  472:     Sz = id(1),
  473:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<<<1:Sz>>/binary>>, [{'Sz',Sz}]),
  474:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<<<1:(id(1))>>/binary>>),
  475:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9>>/binary-unit:16>>),
  476:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9,3:7>>/binary-unit:16>>),
  477:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9,3:7>>/binary-unit:17>>),
  478: 
  479:     %% Failures not deteced by v3_core. Those must be detected at
  480:     %% runtime.
  481:     Atom = id(ok),
  482:     Float = id(2.71),
  483:     List = id([-1,0,1]),
  484:     NonBinaries = [{'Atom',Atom}, {'Float',Float}, {'List',List}],
  485:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Atom/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  486:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Atom/bits,0>>, NonBinaries),
  487:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<0,Atom/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  488:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Float/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  489:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Float/bits,0>>, NonBinaries),
  490:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<List/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  491:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<List/bits,0>>, NonBinaries),
  492: 
  493:     ok.
  494: 
  495: testf_1(W, B) ->
  496:     Vars = [{'W',W}],
  497:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<42:W>>, Vars),
  498:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<3.14:W/float>>, Vars),
  499:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<B:W/binary>>, [{'B',B}|Vars]).
  500: 
  501: %% Test that constructed binaries that are not used will still give an exception.
  502: not_used(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  503:     ok = not_used1(3, <<"dum">>),
  504:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used1(3, "dum")),
  505:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used2(444, -2)),
  506:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used2(444, anka)),
  507:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used3(444)),
  508:     ok.
  509: 
  510: not_used1(I, BinString) ->
  511:     <<I:32,BinString/binary>>,
  512:     ok.
  513: 
  514: not_used2(I, Sz) ->
  515:     <<I:Sz>>,
  516:     ok.
  517: 
  518: not_used3(I) ->
  519:     <<I:(-8)>>,
  520:     ok.
  521: 
  522: in_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  523:     1 = in_guard(<<16#74ad:16>>, 16#e95, 5),
  524:     2 = in_guard(<<16#3A,16#F7,"hello">>, 16#3AF7, <<"hello">>),
  525:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,3.1415/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 3.1415),
  526:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,3/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 3),
  527:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,(2 bsl 226)/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 2 bsl 226),
  528:     nope = in_guard(<<1>>, 42, b),
  529:     nope = in_guard(<<1>>, a, b),
  530:     nope = in_guard(<<1,2>>, 1, 1),
  531:     nope = in_guard(<<4,5>>, 1, 2.71),
  532:     nope = in_guard(<<4,5>>, 1, <<12,13>>),
  533:     ok.
  534: 
  535: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:13,B:3>> == Bin -> 1;
  536: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:16,B/binary>> == Bin -> 2;
  537: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:14,B/float,3:2>> == Bin -> 3;
  538: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when {a,b,<<A:14,B/float,3:2>>} == Bin -> cant_happen;
  539: in_guard(_, _, _) -> nope.
  540: 
  541: %% Make sure that construction has no memory leak
  542: mem_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     B = make_bin(16, <<0>>),
  544:     mem_leak(1024, B),
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: mem_leak(0, _) -> ok;
  548: mem_leak(N, B) ->
  549:     big_bin(B, <<23>>),
  550:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch big_bin(B, bad)),
  551:     mem_leak(N-1, B).
  552: 
  553: big_bin(B1, B2) ->
  554:     <<B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  555:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  556:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  557:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  558:       B2/binary>>.
  559:     
  560: make_bin(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  561: make_bin(N, Acc) -> make_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary,Acc/binary>>).
  562: 
  563: -define(COF(Int0),
  564: 	(fun(Int) ->
  565: 		 true = <<Int:16/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):16/float>>,
  566: 		 true = <<Int:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):32/float>>,
  567: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  568: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  569: 	true = <<Int0:16/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):16/float>>,
  570: 	true = <<Int0:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):32/float>>,
  571: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  572: 
  573: -define(COF32(Int0),
  574: 	(fun(Int) ->
  575: 		 true = <<Int:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):32/float>>,
  576: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  577: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  578: 	true = <<Int0:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):32/float>>,
  579: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  580: 
  581: -define(COF64(Int0),
  582: 	(fun(Int) ->
  583: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  584: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  585: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  586: 
  587: nonliteral(X) -> X.
  588:     
  589: coerce_to_float(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  590:     ?COF(0),
  591:     ?COF(-1),
  592:     ?COF(1),
  593:     ?COF(42),
  594:     ?COF(255),
  595:     ?COF(-255),
  596:     ?COF(38474),
  597:     ?COF(65504),
  598:     ?COF(-65504),
  599:     ?COF32(387498738948729893849444444443),
  600:     ?COF32(-37489378937773899999999999999993),
  601:     ?COF64(298748888888888888888888888883478264866528467367364766666666666666663),
  602:     ?COF64(-367546729879999999999947826486652846736736476555566666663),
  603:     ok.
  604: 
  605: bjorn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  606:     error = bjorn_1(),
  607:     ok.
  608: 
  609: bjorn_1() ->
  610:     Bitstr = <<7:13>>,
  611:     try
  612: 	do_something()
  613:     catch
  614: 	throw:blurf ->
  615: 	    ignore
  616:     end,
  617:     do_more(Bitstr, 13).
  618: 
  619: do_more(Bin, Sz) ->
  620:     %% Previous bug in the bs_bits_to_bytes instruction: The exeption code
  621:     %% was not set - the previous exception (throw:blurf) would be used,
  622:     %% causing the catch to slip.
  623:     try <<Bin:Sz/binary>> of
  624: 	_V -> ok
  625:     catch
  626: 	error:_ ->
  627: 	    error
  628:     end.
  629: 
  630: do_something() ->
  631:     throw(blurf).
  632: 
  633: append_empty_is_same(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     NonWritableBin = <<"123">>,
  635:     true = erts_debug:same(NonWritableBin, append(NonWritableBin, <<>>)),
  636:     WritableBin = <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7>>,
  637:     true = erts_debug:same(WritableBin, append(WritableBin, <<>>)),
  638:     ok.
  639: 
  640: append(A, B) ->
  641:     <<A/binary, B/binary>>.
  642: 
  643: huge_float_field(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  644:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0.0:9/float-unit:8>>),
  645:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:67108865/float-unit:64>>),
  646:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:((1 bsl 26)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  647:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:(id(67108865))/float-unit:64>>),
  648: %%  huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:((1 bsl 60)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  649:     huge_float_check(catch <<3839739387439387383739387987347983:((1 bsl 26)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  650: %%  huge_float_check(catch <<3839739387439387383739387987347983:((1 bsl 60)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  651:     ok.
  652: 
  653: huge_float_check({'EXIT',{system_limit,_}}) -> ok;
  654: huge_float_check({'EXIT',{badarg,_}}) -> ok.
  655: 
  656: system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  657:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  658:     BitsPerWord = WordSize * 8,
  659:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  660: 	(catch <<0:(id(0)),42:(id(1 bsl BitsPerWord))>>),
  661:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  662: 	(catch <<42:(id(1 bsl BitsPerWord)),0:(id(0))>>),
  663:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  664: 	(catch <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0:(id(1 bsl 100))>>),
  665: 
  666:     %% Would fail to load.
  667:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 67)>>),
  668:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 64)+1)>>),
  669: 
  670:     case WordSize of
  671: 	4 ->
  672: 	    system_limit_32();
  673: 	8 ->
  674: 	    ok
  675:     end.
  676: 
  677: system_limit_32() ->
  678:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(-1)>>),
  679:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(-1))>>),
  680:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(-389739873536870912))/unit:8>>),
  681:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<42:536870912/unit:8>>),
  682:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(536870912))/unit:8>>),
  683:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(8)),42:536870912/unit:8>>),
  684:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(8)),42:(id(536870912))/unit:8>>),
  685: 
  686:     %% The size would be silently truncated, resulting in a crash.
  687:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 35)>>),
  688:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 32)+1)>>),
  689: 
  690:     %% Would fail to load.
  691:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 43)>>),
  692:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 40)+1)>>),
  693:     ok.
  694: 
  695: badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  696:     <<3:2>> = <<1:(id(1)),1:(id(1))>>,
  697:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(1)),0:(id(-1))>>),
  698:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(1)),0:(id(-(1 bsl 70)))>>),
  699:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(-(1 bsl 70))),0:(id(1))>>),
  700:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0:(id(-(1)))>>),
  701:     ok.
  702: 
  703: copy_writable_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  704:     [copy_writable_binary_1(I) || I <- lists:seq(0, 256)],
  705:     ok.
  706: 
  707: copy_writable_binary_1(_) ->
  708:     Bin0 = <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7>>,
  709:     SubBin = make_sub_bin(Bin0),
  710:     id(<<42,34,55,Bin0/binary>>),		%Make reallocation likelier.
  711:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  712: 			      copy_writable_binary_holder(Bin0, SubBin)
  713: 		      end),
  714:     Tab = ets:new(holder, []),
  715:     ets:insert(Tab, {17,Bin0}),
  716:     ets:insert(Tab, {42,SubBin}),
  717:     id(<<Bin0/binary,0:(64*1024*8)>>),
  718:     Pid ! self(),
  719:     [{17,Bin0}] = ets:lookup(Tab, 17),
  720:     [{42,Bin0}] = ets:lookup(Tab, 42),
  721:     receive
  722: 	{Pid,Bin0,Bin0} -> ok;
  723: 	Other ->
  724: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected message: ~p", [Other])
  725:     end,
  726:     ok.
  727: 
  728: copy_writable_binary_holder(Bin, SubBin) ->
  729:     receive
  730: 	Pid ->
  731: 	    Pid ! {self(),Bin,SubBin}
  732:     end.
  733: 
  734: make_sub_bin(Bin0) ->
  735:     N = bit_size(Bin0),
  736:     <<_:17,Bin:N/bitstring,_:5>> = <<(-1):17,Bin0/bitstring,(-1):5>>,
  737:     Bin = Bin0,					%Assertion.
  738:     Bin.
  739: 
  740: %% Make sure that bit syntax expression with huge field size are
  741: %% not constructed at compile time.
  742: 
  743: kostis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  744:     case have_250_terabytes_of_ram() of
  745: 	true ->
  746: 	    Bin = <<0:800000000000>>,
  747: 	    EmbeddedBin = <<0,(<<0:99999999999>>)/bitstring,1>>,
  748: 	    Bin0 = list_to_binary([Bin,Bin,Bin,Bin,Bin]),
  749: 	    Bin1 = list_to_binary([Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0]),
  750: 	    Bin2 = list_to_binary([Bin1,Bin1]),
  751: 	    id({EmbeddedBin,Bin0,Bin1,Bin2});
  752: 	false ->
  753: 	    ok
  754:     end.
  755: 
  756: %% I'm not even certain how much 250 TB really is...
  757: %% but I'm sure I don't have it :-)
  758: 
  759: have_250_terabytes_of_ram() -> false.
  760: 
  761: %% Test that different ways of using bit syntax instructions
  762: %% give the same result.
  763: 
  764: dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  765:     dynamic_1(fun dynamic_big/5),
  766:     dynamic_1(fun dynamic_little/5),
  767:     ok.
  768: 		      
  769: dynamic_1(Dynamic) ->
  770:     <<Lpad:128>> = erlang:md5([0]),
  771:     <<Rpad:128>> = erlang:md5([1]),
  772:     <<Int:128>> = erlang:md5([2]),
  773:     8385 = dynamic_2(0, {Int,Lpad,Rpad,Dynamic}, 0).
  774: 
  775: dynamic_2(129, _, Count) -> Count;
  776: dynamic_2(Bef, Data, Count0) ->
  777:     Count = dynamic_3(Bef, 128-Bef, Data, Count0),
  778:     dynamic_2(Bef+1, Data, Count).
  779: 
  780: dynamic_3(_, -1, _, Count) -> Count;
  781: dynamic_3(Bef, N, {Int0,Lpad,Rpad,Dynamic}=Data, Count) ->
  782:     Int1 = Int0 band ((1 bsl (N+3))-1),
  783:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int1, Lpad, Rpad),
  784:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int1, Lpad, Rpad),
  785: 
  786:     %% OTP-7085: Test a small number in a wide field.
  787:     Int2 = Int0 band 16#FFFFFF,
  788:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int2, Lpad, Rpad),
  789:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int2, Lpad, Rpad),
  790:     dynamic_3(Bef, N-1, Data, Count+1).
  791: 
  792: dynamic_big(Bef, N, Int, Lpad, Rpad) ->
  793:     NumBin = id(<<Int:N>>),
  794:     MaskedInt = Int band ((1 bsl N) - 1),
  795:     <<MaskedInt:N>> = NumBin,
  796: 
  797:     %% Construct the binary in two different ways.
  798:     Bin = id(<<Lpad:Bef,NumBin/bitstring,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>),
  799:     Bin = <<Lpad:Bef,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>,
  800: 
  801:     %% Units are seldom used with integer segments even in our test
  802:     %% suites, and I have never seen non-power-of-two units in
  803:     %% production code.
  804:     if
  805:         Bef rem 8 =:= 0 ->
  806:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 8)/unit:8,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>;
  807:         Bef rem 7 =:= 0 ->
  808:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 7)/unit:7,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>;
  809:         (128-Bef-N) rem 5 =:= 0 ->
  810:             Aft = (128 - Bef - N) div 5,
  811:             Bin = <<Lpad:Bef,Int:N,Rpad:Aft/unit:5>>;
  812:         true ->
  813:             ok
  814:     end,
  815: 
  816:     %% Further verify the result by matching.
  817:     LpadMasked = Lpad band ((1 bsl Bef) - 1),
  818:     RpadMasked = Rpad band ((1 bsl (128-Bef-N)) - 1),
  819:     Rbits = (128-Bef-N),
  820:     <<LpadMasked:Bef,MaskedInt:N,RpadMasked:Rbits>> = id(Bin),
  821:     ok.
  822: 
  823: dynamic_little(Bef, N, Int, Lpad, Rpad) ->
  824:     NumBin = id(<<Int:N/little>>),
  825:     MaskedInt = Int band ((1 bsl N) - 1),
  826:     <<MaskedInt:N/little>> = NumBin,
  827: 
  828:     %% Construct the binary in two different ways.
  829:     Bin = id(<<Lpad:Bef/little,NumBin/bitstring,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>),
  830:     Bin = <<Lpad:Bef/little,Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>,
  831: 
  832:     if
  833:         Bef rem 8 =:= 0 ->
  834:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 8)/little-unit:8,
  835:                     Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>;
  836:         Bef rem 9 =:= 0 ->
  837:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 9)/little-unit:9,
  838:                     Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>;
  839:         (128-Bef-N) rem 17 =:= 0 ->
  840:             Aft = (128 - Bef - N) div 17,
  841:             Bin = <<Lpad:Bef/little,Int:N/little,Rpad:Aft/little-unit:17>>;
  842:         true ->
  843:             ok
  844:     end,
  845: 
  846:     %% Further verify the result by matching.
  847:     LpadMasked = Lpad band ((1 bsl Bef) - 1),
  848:     RpadMasked = Rpad band ((1 bsl (128-Bef-N)) - 1),
  849:     Rbits = (128-Bef-N),
  850:     <<LpadMasked:Bef/little,MaskedInt:N/little,RpadMasked:Rbits/little>> = id(Bin),
  851:     ok.
  852: 
  853: %% Test that the bs_add/5 instruction handles big numbers correctly.
  854: bs_add(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  855:     Mod = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
  856:                            atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
  857:     N = 2000,
  858:     Code = [{module, Mod},
  859: 	    {exports, [{bs_add,2}]},
  860: 	    {labels, 2},
  861: 
  862: 	    %% bs_add(Number, -SmallestBig) -> Number + N
  863: 	    {function, bs_add, 2, 2},
  864: 	    {label,1},
  865: 	    {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,bs_add},2},
  866: 
  867: 	    {label,2},
  868: 	    {move,{x,0},{x,2}}] ++
  869: 	lists:duplicate(N-1, {bs_add,{f,0},[{x,2},{integer,1},1],{x,2}}) ++
  870: 	[{gc_bif,abs,{f,0},3,[{x,1}],{x,4}},	%Force GC, ignore result.
  871: 	 {gc_bif,'+',{f,0},3,[{x,2},{integer,1}],{x,0}}, %Safe result in {x,0}
  872: 	 return],
  873: 
  874:     %% Write assembly file and assemble it.
  875:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  876:     RootName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  877:     AsmFile = RootName ++ ".S",
  878:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write]),
  879:     [io:format(Fd, "~p. \n", [T]) || T <- Code],
  880:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  881:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,report,{outdir,PrivDir}]),
  882:     LoadRc = code:load_abs(RootName),
  883:     {module,_Module} = LoadRc,
  884: 
  885:     %% Find smallest positive bignum.
  886:     SmallestBig = smallest_big(),
  887:     io:format("~p\n", [SmallestBig]),
  888:     DoTest = fun() ->
  889: 		     exit(Mod:bs_add(SmallestBig, -SmallestBig))
  890: 	     end,
  891:     {Pid,Mref} = spawn_monitor(DoTest),
  892:     receive
  893: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Pid,Res} -> ok
  894:     end,
  895: 
  896:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  897:         8 ->
  898:             %% bignum-sized binaries must system_limit on 64-bit platforms
  899:             {system_limit, _} = Res;
  900:         4 ->
  901:             Res = SmallestBig + N
  902:     end,
  903: 
  904:     %% Clean up.
  905:     ok = file:delete(AsmFile),
  906:     ok = file:delete(code:which(Mod)),
  907:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  908:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  909: 
  910:     ok.
  911: 
  912: 
  913: smallest_big() ->
  914:     smallest_big_1(1 bsl 24).
  915: 
  916: smallest_big_1(N) ->
  917:     case erts_debug:flat_size(N) of
  918: 	0 -> smallest_big_1(N+N);
  919: 	_  -> N
  920:     end.
  921: 
  922: otp_7422(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  923:     otp_7422_int(0),
  924:     otp_7422_bin(0).
  925: 
  926: otp_7422_int(N) when N < 512 ->
  927:     T = erlang:make_tuple(N, []),
  928:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  929: 		       id(T),
  930: 		       %% A size of field 0 would write one byte beyond
  931: 		       %% the current position in the binary. It could
  932: 		       %% overwrite the continuation pointer stored on
  933: 		       %% the stack if HTOP was equal to E (the stack pointer).
  934: 		       id(<<0:(id(0))>>)
  935: 	       end),
  936:     otp_7422_int(N+1);
  937: otp_7422_int(_) -> ok.
  938: 
  939: otp_7422_bin(N) when N < 512 ->
  940:     T = erlang:make_tuple(N, []),
  941:     Z = id(<<>>),
  942:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  943: 		       id(T),
  944: 		       id(<<Z:(id(0))/bits>>)
  945: 	       end),
  946:     otp_7422_bin(N+1);
  947: otp_7422_bin(_) -> ok.
  948: 
  949: zero_width(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  950:     Z = id(0),
  951:     Small = id(42),
  952:     Big = id(1 bsl 128),
  953:     <<>> = <<Small:Z>>,
  954:     <<>> = <<Small:0>>,
  955:     <<>> = <<Big:Z>>,
  956:     <<>> = <<Big:0>>,
  957:     
  958:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<not_a_number:0>>),
  959:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(not_a_number)):Z>>),
  960:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(not_a_number)):0>>),
  961: 
  962:     ok.
  963: 
  964: bad_append(_) ->
  965:     do_bad_append(<<127:1>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  966:     do_bad_append(<<127:2>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  967:     do_bad_append(<<127:17>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  968: 
  969:     do_bad_append(<<127:3>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  970:     do_bad_append(<<127:5>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  971:     do_bad_append(<<127:7>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  972:     do_bad_append(<<127:199>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  973: 
  974:     do_bad_append(<<127:7>>, fun append_unit_8/1),
  975:     do_bad_append(<<127:9>>, fun append_unit_8/1),
  976: 
  977:     do_bad_append(<<0:8>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  978:     do_bad_append(<<0:15>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  979:     do_bad_append(<<0:17>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  980:     ok.
  981: 
  982: do_bad_append(Bin0, Appender) ->
  983:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin0)),
  984: 
  985:     Bin1 = id(<<0:3,Bin0/bitstring>>),
  986:     <<_:3,Bin2/bitstring>> = Bin1,
  987:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin2)),
  988: 
  989:     %% Create a writable binary.
  990:     Empty = id(<<>>),
  991:     Bin3 = <<Empty/bitstring,Bin0/bitstring>>,
  992:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin3)),
  993:     ok.
  994: 
  995: append_unit_3(Bin) ->
  996:     <<Bin/binary-unit:3,0:1>>.
  997: 
  998: append_unit_4(Bin) ->
  999:     <<Bin/binary-unit:4,0:1>>.
 1000: 
 1001: append_unit_8(Bin) ->
 1002:     <<Bin/binary,0:1>>.
 1003: 
 1004: append_unit_16(Bin) ->
 1005:     <<Bin/binary-unit:16,0:1>>.
 1006: 
 1007: %% Test that the bs_append instruction will correctly check for
 1008: %% overflow by producing a binary whose total size would exceed the
 1009: %% maximum allowed size for a binary on a 32-bit computer.
 1010: 
 1011: bs_append_overflow(_Config) ->
 1012:     Memsize = memsize(),
 1013:     io:format("Memsize = ~w Bytes~n", [Memsize]),
 1014:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1015: 	8 ->
 1016:             %% Not possible to test on a 64-bit computer.
 1017: 	    {skip, "64-bit architecture"};
 1018:         _ when Memsize < (2 bsl 30) ->
 1019: 	    {skip, "Less than 2 GB of memory"};
 1020: 	4 ->
 1021:             {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} = (catch bs_append_overflow_signed()),
 1022:             erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1023:             {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} = (catch bs_append_overflow_unsigned()),
 1024:             erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1025: 	    ok
 1026:     end.
 1027: 
 1028: bs_append_overflow_signed() ->
 1029:     %% Produce a large binary that, if cast to signed int, would
 1030:     %% overflow into a negative number that fits a smallnum.
 1031:     Large = <<0:((1 bsl 30)-1)>>,
 1032:     <<Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits,
 1033:       Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits,
 1034:       Large/bits>>.
 1035: 
 1036: bs_append_overflow_unsigned() ->
 1037:     %% The following would succeed but would produce an incorrect result
 1038:     %% where B =:= C!
 1039:     A = <<0:((1 bsl 32)-8)>>,
 1040:     B = <<2, 3>>,
 1041:     C = <<A/binary,1,B/binary>>,
 1042:     true = byte_size(B) < byte_size(C).
 1043: 
 1044: bs_append_offheap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1045:     %% test that erts_bs_private_append is reflected correctly in
 1046:     %%  process_info(Pid, binary()) report for off-heap binaries.
 1047:     {Pid, MRef} = erlang:spawn_monitor(fun bs_append_offheap_proc/0),
 1048:     receive
 1049:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} ->
 1050:             ok;
 1051:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {{badmatch,[{binary,[]}]}, _}} ->
 1052:             {fail, "missing binary in erts_bs_private_append"}
 1053:     end.
 1054: 
 1055: bs_append_offheap_proc() ->
 1056:     Self = self(),
 1057:     Len = 128,
 1058:     OffHeapBin = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Len, $b)),
 1059:     erlang:garbage_collect(Self),
 1060:     [{binary, [{_, Len, 1}]}] = erlang:process_info(Self, [binary]),
 1061:     Bin = <<OffHeapBin/binary, "a">>,
 1062:     erlang:garbage_collect(Self),
 1063:     %% expect a single binary (2 bytes longer than the original)
 1064:     [{binary, [{_, _, 1}]}] = erlang:process_info(Self, [binary]),
 1065:     Bin.
 1066: 
 1067: reductions(_Config) ->
 1068:     TwoMeg = <<0:(2_000*1024)/unit:8>>,
 1069:     reds_at_least(2000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg/binary>> end),
 1070:     reds_at_least(4000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg/binary,TwoMeg/binary>> end),
 1071:     reds_at_least(1000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg:(1000*1024)/binary>> end),
 1072: 
 1073:     %% Here we expect about 500 reductions in the bs_append
 1074:     %% instruction for setting up a writable binary and about 2000
 1075:     %% reductions in the bs_put_binary instruction for copying the
 1076:     %% binary data.
 1077:     reds_at_least(2500, fun() -> <<TwoMeg/binary,TwoMeg:(2000*1024)/binary>> end),
 1078:     ok.
 1079: 
 1080: reds_at_least(N, Fun) ->
 1081:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1082:     {reductions,Red0} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1083:     _ = Fun(),
 1084:     {reductions,Red1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1085:     Diff = Red1 - Red0,
 1086:     io:format("Expected at least ~p; got ~p\n", [N,Diff]),
 1087:     if
 1088:         Diff >= N ->
 1089:             ok;
 1090:         Diff ->
 1091:             ct:fail({expected,N,got,Diff})
 1092:     end.
 1093: memsize() ->
 1094:     application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
 1095:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1096:         undefined ->
 1097:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1098:             Tot;
 1099:         Available ->
 1100:             Available
 1101:     end.
 1102: 
 1103: -define(FP16(EncodedInt, Float),
 1104:         (fun(NlInt, NlFloat) ->
 1105:                  {0, true} = {0, <<NlInt:16>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float>>},
 1106:                  {1, true} = {1, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float>>},
 1107:                  {2, true} = {2, <<NlInt:16/little>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float-little>>},
 1108:                  {3, true} = {3, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16/little>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float-little>>},
 1109:                  {4, true} = {4, <<NlInt:16/native>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float-native>>},
 1110:                  {5, true} = {5, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16/native>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float-native>>}
 1111:          end)(nonliteral(EncodedInt), nonliteral(Float)),
 1112:         {a, true} = {a, <<EncodedInt:16>> =:= <<Float:16/float>>},
 1113:         {b, true} = {b, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16>> =:= <<-Float:16/float>>},
 1114:         {c, true} = {c, <<EncodedInt:16/little>> =:= <<Float:16/float-little>>},
 1115:         {d, true} = {d, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16/little>> =:= <<-Float:16/float-little>>},
 1116:         {e, true} = {e, <<EncodedInt:16/native>> =:= <<Float:16/float-native>>},
 1117:         {f, true} = {f, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16/native>> =:= <<-Float:16/float-native>>}).
 1118: 
 1119: fp16(_Config) ->
 1120:     %% smallest positive subnormal number
 1121:     ?FP16(16#0001, 0.000000059604645),
 1122:     %% largest positive subnormal number
 1123:     ?FP16(16#03ff, 0.000060975552),
 1124:     %% smallest positive normal number
 1125:     ?FP16(16#0400, 0.00006103515625),
 1126:     %% largest normal number
 1127:     ?FP16(16#7bff, 65504),
 1128:     ?FP16(16#7bff, 65504.0),
 1129:     %% largest number less than one
 1130:     ?FP16(16#3bff, 0.99951172),
 1131:     %% zero
 1132:     ?FP16(16#0000, 0.0),
 1133:     %% one
 1134:     ?FP16(16#3c00, 1),
 1135:     ?FP16(16#3c00, 1.0),
 1136:     %% smallest number larger than one
 1137:     ?FP16(16#3c01, 1.00097656),
 1138:     %% rounding of 1/3 to nearest
 1139:     ?FP16(16#3555, 0.33325195),
 1140:     %% others
 1141:     ?FP16(16#4000, 2),
 1142:     ?FP16(16#4000, 2.0),
 1143:     ok.
 1144: 
 1145: zero_init(_Config) ->
 1146:     <<LPad:64/bits,RPad:64/bits>> = id(erlang:md5([42])),
 1147:     Sizes = [511,512,513, 767,768,769, 1023,1024,1025,
 1148:              16#7fff,16#ffff,16#10000] ++ lists:seq(0, 257),
 1149:     _ = [do_zero_init(Size, LPad, RPad) || Size <- Sizes],
 1150:     ok.
 1151: 
 1152: do_zero_init(Size, LPad, RPad) ->
 1153:     try
 1154:         do_zero_init_1(Size, LPad, RPad)
 1155:     catch
 1156:         C:R:Stk ->
 1157:             io:format("Size = ~p, LPad = ~p, RPad = ~p\n", [Size, LPad, RPad]),
 1158:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1159:     end.
 1160: 
 1161: do_zero_init_1(Size, LPad, RPad) ->
 1162:     Zeroes = id(<<0:Size>>),
 1163:     <<0:Size>> = Zeroes,
 1164:     Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, Zeroes/bits, RPad:64/bits>>),
 1165:     Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>),
 1166:     Bin = id(<<LPad:(id(64))/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>),
 1167: 
 1168:     if
 1169:         Size rem 11 =:= 0 ->
 1170:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:(Size div 11)/unit:11, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1171:         true ->
 1172:             ok
 1173:     end,
 1174: 
 1175:     case Size of
 1176:         0 ->
 1177:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1178:         1 ->
 1179:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1180:         2 ->
 1181:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1182:         3 ->
 1183:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1184:         4 ->
 1185:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1186:         5 ->
 1187:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1188:         6 ->
 1189:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1190:         7 ->
 1191:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1192:         8 ->
 1193:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1194:         9 ->
 1195:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1196:         10 ->
 1197:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1198:         11 ->
 1199:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1200:         12 ->
 1201:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1202:         13 ->
 1203:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1204:         14 ->
 1205:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1206:         15 ->
 1207:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1208:         16 ->
 1209:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1210: 
 1211:         31 ->
 1212:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1213:         32 ->
 1214:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1215:         33 ->
 1216:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);

 1220:         48 ->
 1221:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1222:         49 ->
 1223:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1224: 
 1225:         63 ->

 1227:         64 ->

 1229:         65 ->

 1236:         81 ->

 1370: 
 1371: 
 1372: -define(ERROR_INFO(Expr),
 1373:         fun() ->
 1374:                 try Expr of
 1375:                     _ ->
 1376:                         error(should_fail)
 1377:                 catch
 1378:                     error:Reason:Stk ->
 1379:                         error_info_verify(Reason, Stk, ??Expr, #{})
 1380:                 end
 1381:         end()).
 1382: 
 1383: -define(ERROR_INFO(Expr, Overrides),
 1384:         fun() ->
 1385:                 try Expr of
 1386:                     _ ->
 1387:                         error(should_fail)
 1388:                 catch
 1389:                     error:Reason:Stk ->
 1390:                         error_info_verify(Reason, Stk, ??Expr, Overrides)
 1391:                 end
 1392:         end()).
 1393: 
 1394: error_info(_Config) ->
 1395:     case ?MODULE of
 1396:         bs_construct_r24_SUITE ->
 1397:             %% Error information is not implemented for old bit syntax
 1398:             %% instructions.
 1399:             ok;
 1400:         _ ->
 1401:             error_info()
 1402:     end.
 1403: 
 1404: error_info() ->
 1405:     Atom = id(some_atom),
 1406:     NegSize = id(-1),
 1407:     HugeNegSize = id(-1 bsl 64),
 1408:     Binary = id(<<"abc">>),
 1409:     HugeBig = id(1 bsl 1500),
 1410:     LongList = lists:seq(1, 100),
 1411:     BadBinary = id(ok),
 1412:     BadSize = case Atom of
 1413:                   a -> 0;
 1414:                   _ -> bad_size
 1415:               end,
 1416: 
 1417:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/binary, Binary/binary>>),
 1418:     {badarg, {2,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1419:     {badarg, {3,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<1:32, Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1420:     {badarg, {4,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<1:32, "xyz", Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1421: 
 1422:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:32>>),
 1423:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:(id(32))>>),
 1424:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,LongList}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<LongList:32>>),
 1425:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:Atom>>),
 1426:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:32>>),
 1427:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:NegSize>>),
 1428:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:HugeNegSize>>),
 1429:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 58}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 58)/unit:255>>),
 1430:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 60}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 60)/unit:8>>),
 1431:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 64)>>),
 1432: 
 1433:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:10/binary>>),
 1434:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:(id(10))/binary>>),
 1435:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:Atom/binary>>),
 1436:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:NegSize/binary>>),
 1437:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:HugeNegSize/binary>>),
 1438:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,BadSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:BadSize/binary>>),
 1439:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,BadSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<BadBinary:BadSize/binary>>),
 1440:     {badarg, {1,binary,short,Binary}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:10/binary>>),
 1441:     {badarg, {1,binary,short,Binary}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(id(10))/binary>>),
 1442:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/binary>>),
 1443:     {badarg, {1,binary,unit,<<1:1>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<(id(<<1:1>>))/binary>>),
 1444:     {badarg, {1,binary,unit,<<0:1111>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<(id(<<0:1111>>))/binary>>),
 1445:     {badarg, {2,binary,unit,<<1:1>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0, (id(<<1:1>>))/binary>>),
 1446:     {badarg, {2,binary,unit,<<0:1111>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0, (id(<<0:1111>>))/binary>>),
 1447:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(1 bsl 64)/binary>>),
 1448:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(id(1 bsl 64))/binary>>),
 1449: 
 1450:     {badarg, {1,float,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>),
 1451:     {badarg, {1,float,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:Atom/float>>),
 1452:     {badarg, {1,float,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:NegSize/float>>),
 1453:     {badarg, {1,float,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:HugeNegSize/float>>),
 1454:     {badarg, {1,float,invalid,1}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:(id(1))/float>>),
 1455:     {badarg, {1,float,no_float,HugeBig}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<HugeBig:(id(64))/float>>),
 1456:     {badarg, {1,float,no_float,HugeBig}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<HugeBig:64/float>>),
 1457:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:(id(1 bsl 64))/float>>),
 1458: 
 1459:     {badarg, {1,utf8,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf8>>),
 1460:     {badarg, {1,utf16,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf16>>),
 1461:     {badarg, {1,utf32,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf32>>),
 1462: 
 1463:     Bin = id(<<>>),
 1464:     Float = id(42.0),
 1465:     MaxSmall = (1 bsl 59) - 1,                  %Max small for 64-bit architectures.
 1466: 
 1467:     %% Attempt constructing a binary with total size 1^64 + 32.
 1468: 
 1469:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:32,0:64>>),
 1470:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1471:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:32,0:64>>),
 1472:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1473: 
 1474:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1475:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1476:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1477:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1478: 
 1479:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1480:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1481:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1482:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1483: 
 1484:     %% Test a size exceeding 1^64, where the sign bit (bit 63) is not set.
 1485:     0 = (((MaxSmall) * 33) bsr 63) band 1, %Assertion: The sign bit is not set.
 1486: 
 1487:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:33>>),
 1488:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:33>>),
 1489:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:33>>),
 1490:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:33>>),
 1491: 
 1492:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:33>>),
 1493:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:33>>),
 1494:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:33>>),
 1495:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:33>>),
 1496: 
 1497:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:33>>),
 1498:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:33>>),
 1499:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:33>>),
 1500:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:33>>),
 1501: 
 1502:     %% error messages with options
 1503:     PP = fun(Term) -> <<"'", (erlang:atom_to_binary(Term))/binary, "'">> end,
 1504: 
 1505:     {_, _, <<"segment 1 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: some_atom">>} =
 1506:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{}),
 1507: 
 1508:     {_, _, <<"segment 2 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: some_atom">>} =
 1509:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{override_segment_position => 2}),
 1510: 
 1511:     {_, _, <<"segment 1 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: 'some_atom'">>} =
 1512:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{pretty_printer => PP}),
 1513: 
 1514:     ok.
 1515: 
 1516: error_info_verify(Reason, Stk0, Expr, Overrides) ->
 1517:     [{?MODULE, Fun, Arity, Info0}|Rest] = Stk0,
 1518:     {value, {error_info, ErrorInfo}, Info1} = lists:keytake(error_info, 1, Info0),
 1519:     #{cause := Cause, module := Module, function := Function} = ErrorInfo,
 1520:     Info2 = maps:merge(ErrorInfo, Overrides),
 1521:     Stk1 = [{?MODULE, Fun, Arity, Info1 ++ [{error_info, Info2}]} | Rest],
 1522:     Result = Module:Function(Reason, Stk1),
 1523:     #{general := String} = Result,
 1524:     true = is_binary(String),
 1525:     io:format("~ts: ~ts\n", [Expr,String]),
 1526:     {Reason, Cause, String}.
 1527: 
 1528: little(_Config) ->
 1529:     _ = rand:uniform(),				%Seed generator
 1530:     io:format("Seed: ~p", [rand:export_seed()]),
 1531: 
 1532:     RandBytes = rand:bytes(10),
 1533:     _ = [do_little(RandBytes, N) || N <- lists:seq(0, 10*8)],
 1534: 
 1535:     ok.
 1536: 
 1537: do_little(Bin0, N) ->
 1538:     <<Bin1:N/bits,Bin2/bits>> = Bin0,
 1539:     Bin2Size = bit_size(Bin2),
 1540: 
 1541:     <<I1:N/little-integer>> = Bin1,
 1542:     <<I2:Bin2Size/little-integer>> = Bin2,
 1543: 
 1544:     Bin1 = <<I1:N/little-integer>>,
 1545:     Bin1 = do_little_1(N, id(I1)),
 1546: 
 1547:     Bin2 = <<I2:Bin2Size/little-integer>>,
 1548:     Bin2 = do_little_1(Bin2Size, id(I2)),
 1549: 
 1550:     ok.
 1551: 
 1552: do_little_1(0, I) -> <<I:0/little-integer>>;
 1553: do_little_1(1, I) -> <<I:1/little-integer>>;
 1554: do_little_1(2, I) -> <<I:2/little-integer>>;
 1555: do_little_1(3, I) -> <<I:3/little-integer>>;
 1556: do_little_1(4, I) -> <<I:4/little-integer>>;

 1558: do_little_1(6, I) -> <<I:6/little-integer>>;
 1559: do_little_1(7, I) -> <<I:7/little-integer>>;
 1560: do_little_1(8, I) -> <<I:8/little-integer>>;
 1561: do_little_1(9, I) -> <<I:9/little-integer>>;
 1562: do_little_1(10, I) -> <<I:10/little-integer>>;

 1567: do_little_1(15, I) -> <<I:15/little-integer>>;
 1568: do_little_1(16, I) -> <<I:16/little-integer>>;

 1682: %% GH-7469: The unit of variable-sized segments wasn't checked properly,
 1683: %% resulting in the creation of heap binaries for non-binary bitstrings.
 1684: heap_binary_unit(_Config) ->
 1685:     {ok, 14524} = heap_binary_unit_1(id(<<184,188,2,66,172,19,0,3>>)),
 1686:     ok.
 1687: 
 1688: heap_binary_unit_1(<<2:2/integer,Rest:62/bitstring>>) ->
 1689:     heap_binary_unit_2(<<2:2/integer>>, Rest).
 1690: 
 1691: heap_binary_unit_2(Variant, Rest) ->
 1692:     VariantSize = bit_size(Variant),
 1693:     ClockHiSize = 8 - VariantSize,
 1694:     ClockSize = 8 + ClockHiSize,
 1695:     case Rest of
 1696:         <<ClockHi:ClockHiSize/bitstring,
 1697:           ClockLo:8/bitstring,
 1698:           _:48/bitstring>> ->
 1699:             case
 1700:                 <<ClockHi:ClockHiSize/bitstring,
 1701:                   ClockLo:8/bitstring>>
 1702:             of
 1703:                 <<Clock:ClockSize/integer-unsigned>> ->
 1704:                     {ok, Clock};
 1705:                 Bin1 ->
 1706:                     {error1, Bin1}
 1707:             end;
 1708:         Bin2 ->
 1709:             {error2, Bin2}
 1710:     end.
 1711: 
 1712: otp_24_code_gh_8238(Config) ->
 1713:     case ?MODULE of
 1714:         bs_construct_SUITE ->
 1715:             %% GH-8238. Code compiled with Erlang/OTP 24 would crash
 1716:             %% when run on OTP-26.2.3.
 1717:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1718:             Asm = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".S"),
 1719:             {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Asm, [binary,from_asm,report]),
 1720:             {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
 1721:             Mod:Mod(),
 1722:             ok;
 1723:         _ ->
 1724:             {skip,"Enough to run once"}
 1725:     end.
 1726:

 1728: %%% Common utilities.
 1729: %%%
 1730: 
 1731: id(I) -> I.
